title: Ambrosio Traversari’s Latin translation of Diogenes Laertius’ Lives of the Philosophers was first printed at Rome in 1472 (the Greek text was first printed at Basel in 1533). In addition to the Dialogues of Lucian, which Erasmus began reading and translating at the very beginning of his career (Thomas More translated Lucian’s Cynicus), another source for the sayings of Diogenes the Cynic was Plutarch’s Moralia, first printed by Aldus Manutius in 1509.
